intro: Cieca trisetosa, commonly known as the hairy cieca, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, as well as its showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in humid, tropical environments. Cieca trisetosa is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
